question: 弾む
sourceMnemonic: Weird that this kanji means <kanji>bullet</kanji> but the verb vocab version means <vocabulary>to bounce</vocabulary>. Just imagine someone shooting a bullet. What does it do when it hits the right materials? It's going <vocabulary>to bounce</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: If you're going <vocabulary>to bounce</vocabulary> something off that wall, it <reading>has</reading> (<ja>はず</ja>) to be made of rubber, otherwise it will just go right through. It <reading>has</reading> to.
